value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 1 - Tenants, governance, collaboration
value.excerpt: As an administrator, how do you manage a Power BI tenant? How do you configure tenant settings, monitor usage, and provision licenses and other organizational resources? This learning path covers typical tasks and tools, such as the Power BI admin portal and Office 365 admin center. You will learn how to establish and provide governance for a Power BI environment and provision Power BI Premium capacity.

topItems.title: Understand the Power BI administrator role
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to administer Power BI to support business decisions backed by data.

topItems.title: Establish a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: This module covers topics relating to establishing a Power BI environment within Office 365 containers.

topItems.title: Provide governance in a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: Learn the fundamental rules, regulations, and policies of a BI governance approach.

topItems.title: Facilitate collaboration and sharing
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to collaborate and share dashboards and reports with coworkers.

value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 2 - Premium, Power BI embedded, automation
value.excerpt: As an administrator, how do you foster collaboration and share Power BI outputs? How do you monitor and audit usage, build a data access infrastructure, and automate administration? This course will demonstrate how Power BI Premium manages capacity resources. Youâ€™ll learn how to establish a data access infrastructure and how to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant. Finally, youâ€™ll learn how to automate common tasks with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

topItems.title: Provision Premium capacity in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the differences between Power BI Pro and Power BI Premium, and how Power BI Premium manages capacity resources.

topItems.title: Establish a data access infrastructure in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to establish a data access infrastructure for accessing all your data within Power BI.

topItems.title: Broaden the reach of Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn the various ways to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant.

topItems.title: Automate Power BI administration
topItems.excerpt: Common manual tasks can be automated with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 2 - Tenants, governance, collaboration
value.excerpt: Power BI administrators manage every aspect of their tenant. This learning path covers advanced administrative tasks, such as fostering collaboration and sharing data. You will earn how to monitor and audit usage, build a data access infrastructure, broaden the reach of Power BI, and automate administration with APIs and PowerShell cmdlets.

topItems.title: Provision Premium capacity in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the differences between Power BI Pro and Power BI Premium, and how Power BI Premium manages capacity resources.

topItems.title: Establish a data access infrastructure in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to establish a data access infrastructure for accessing all your data within Power BI.

topItems.title: Broaden the reach of Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn the various ways to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant.

topItems.title: Automate Power BI administration
topItems.excerpt: Common manual tasks can be automated with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

value.title: Design and build tabular models
value.excerpt: Design and build tabular models

topItems.title: Create Power BI model relationships
topItems.excerpt: Power BI model relationships form the basis of a tabular model. Define Power BI model relationships, set up relationships, recognize DAX relationship functions, and describe relationship evaluation.

topItems.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
topItems.excerpt: By the end of this module, youâ€™ll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

topItems.title: Create calculation groups
topItems.excerpt: Power BI, calculation groups, enterprise data analyst

topItems.title: Enforce Power BI model security
topItems.excerpt: Enforce model security in Power BI using row-level security and object-level security.

value.title: Embed Power BI analytics
value.excerpt: This learning path teaches you how to embed Power BI content in apps, develop programmatic solutions using the Power BI REST API and the Power BI Client APIs, enforce row-level security (RLS) for embedded content, automate common Power BI setup tasks, configure a development environment, and determine appropriate licensing.

topItems.title: Introduction to Power BI embedded analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how developers can programmatically embed analytics in their apps, and about no-code embedding options for simpler requirements.

topItems.title: Select a Power BI embedded analytics product
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to select a Power BI embedded analytics product.

topItems.title: Set up permissions to embed Power BI content
topItems.excerpt: Learn which settings and permissions to use for internal and external users of your app with embedded Power BI content.

topItems.title: Embed Power BI content
topItems.excerpt: Learn about embedding Power BI content.

value.title: Empower modern analytics and business intelligence data cultures with Excel, Power BI, MS Teams, and SharePoint
value.excerpt: Excel is a Microsoft application that has been in use since 1985. You might be surprised that in addition to simple spreadsheets, Excel can enable modern analytics and business intelligence. In this Learning Path, you will learn how to modernize and empower data conversations within your organization using Excel & Power BI together with MS Teams, and SharePoint. Youâ€™ll gain awareness of the business intelligence landscape, technology capabilities, and their roles.

topItems.title: Introduction to modern analytics using Excel and Power BI
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces the Microsoft modern analytics core suite of tools, including Office 365/Excel 2016+, Power Query, Data Model, Power BI Desktop, and Power BI service. By using modern analytics technologies, you and your organization can work faster, more efficiently, and smarter by using Excel together with Power BI.

topItems.title: Automate data cleaning with Power Query
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces Power Query in Microsoft Excel, a powerful data connection, cleaning, and shaping technology that is a core part of the Microsoft modern analytics suite of business intelligence tools.

topItems.title: Introduction to foundations in data modeling
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces the key concepts that are related to developing a well-organized data model.

topItems.title: Transition from Excel to Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Microsoft's Power BI combines the Power Query's extraction, transformation, and loading capabilities with DAX and a relational data model in a new application with new features.
